pageProps.body:
Mosfet

Metal Oxide Semiconducter Field Effect Transistor

Enhancement-Type

Gate voltage causes Source-Drain channel to close circuit

Depletion-Type

Gate voltage causes Source-Drain channel to open circuit

Doping

N-Channel = N-type Source, Drain, Channel with P-type substrate. Positive voltage is applied to the gate to operate.
P-Channel = P-type Source, Drain, Channel with N-type substrate. Negative voltage is applied to the gate to operate.

Caluclations (NMOSFET-E)

saturation
Triode = ohmic = linear
cutoff
VGS=VG−RSIDV_{GS} = V_G - R_SI_DVGS​=VG​−RS​ID​
VS=RSIDV_S = R_SI_DVS​=RS​ID​
RD=VDD−VDIDR_D = \frac{V_{DD}-V_D}{I_D}RD​=ID​VDD​−VD​​
IDsat=12kn′(WL)(VGS−Vt)2(1+λ∗VDS) for VGS≥VT and VDS≥VGS−VTI_{Dsat} = \frac{1}{2}k'_n\left(\frac{W}{L}\right)(V_{GS}-V_t)^2(1+\lambda*V_{DS}) \text{ for }V_{GS} \ge V_T \text{ and } V_{DS} \ge V_{GS}-V_TIDsat​=21​kn′​(LW​)(VGS​−Vt​)2(1+λ∗VDS​) for VGS​≥VT​ and VDS​≥VGS​−VT​
IDlin=kn′(WL)[(VGS−Vt)VDS−12VDS2] for VGS≥VT and VDS≤VGS−VTI_{Dlin} = k'_n\left(\frac{W}{L}\right)\left[(V_{GS}-V_t)V_{DS}-\frac{1}{2}V_{DS}^2\right] \text{ for }V_{GS} \ge V_T \text{ and } V_{DS} \le V_{GS}-V_TIDlin​=kn′​(LW​)[(VGS​−Vt​)VDS​−21​VDS2​] for VGS​≥VT​ and VDS​≤VGS​−VT​
ID=0 for VGS<VTI_D = 0 \text{ for } V_{GS} \lt V_TID​=0 for VGS​<VT​

Constants

conduction parameter=Kn=kn′2∗WL\text{conduction parameter} = K_n = \frac{k'_n}{2}*\frac{W}{L}conduction parameter=Kn​=2kn′​​∗LW​
process conduction parameter=kn′=μnCOx=electron mobility∗oxide capacitance per unit area\text{process conduction parameter} = k'_n = \mu_nC_{Ox} = \text{electron mobility} * \text{oxide capacitance per unit area}process conduction parameter=kn′​=μn​COx​=electron mobility∗oxide capacitance per unit area
transistor design variable=WL=WidthLength\text{transistor design variable} = \frac{W}{L} = \frac{\text{Width}}{\text{Length}}transistor design variable=LW​=LengthWidth​
